org.sd.util
Class PrecisionRecallCalculator

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.util.PrecisionRecallCalculator

public class PrecisionRecallCalculator
extends java.lang.Object

A helper class to collect statistical samples and provide summary statistics at any time.

This class is designed to have a low memory footprint profile at the expense of losing the samples. The effect is that summary statistics that require analyzing each sample (like median) are unavailable.

Author:
Spence Koehler

combine

public static PrecisionRecallCalculator combine(java.lang.String label,
                                                PrecisionRecallCalculator[] statsAccumulators)
Combine the data from multiple statsAccumulators.

This behaves as though a single statsAccumulator accumulated all of the data from the given statsAccumulators in the first place. This differs from summarize in that all of the min, max, and sum data is preserved instead of summarizing the means of the statsAccumulators.

Parameters:
label - The label for the new statsAccumulator (okay if null).
statsAccumulators - The statsAccumulators to combine.
Returns:
a statsAccumulator that combines the data of the given statsAccumulators.
